abstract: Pres Obama announces he has authorized limited airstrikes against Islamic militants in Iraq; move, bid to avert fall of Kurdish capital of Erbil, returns United States to significant battlefield role in Iraq for first time since last American soldier left country at end of 2011; also says American military has dropped food and water to tens of thousands of Iraqis trapped in mountain range in northern Iraq.

byline.original: By HELENE COOPER, MARK LANDLER and ALISSA J. RUBIN
byline.contributor: Helene Cooper and Mark Landler reported from Washington, and Alissa J. Rubin from Dohuk, Iraq. Thom Shanker, Michael D. Shear and Julie Hirschfeld Davis contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: President Obama announced that he had authorized targeted American airstrikes against militants in Iraq, scrambling to avert the fall of the Kurdish capital. He also said that U.S. aircraft has dropped aid for tens of thousands of Iraqis trapped on a mountain range.

headline.sub: U.S. Drops Food to Aid Iraqi Refugees
headline.main: Obama Allows Limited Airstrikes on ISIS
headline.print_headline: Obama Allows Airstrikes Against Iraq Rebels
